DataElement.preferredName: Record Identification Facility Identification Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The FIN Coding System is a generated code that identifies the coding system used by individual facilities (hospital, clinics, or other providers).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A document  providing permanent evidence of identity of the individual building or place that provides a particular service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Record; anything, e.g. a document, providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.:Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.
The procedure of having an identity established.

Property.preferredDefinition: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Facility Identification Number Coding Number Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The FIN coding system is a generated code that identifies the coding system used by individual facilities._The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis. (from Wikipedia)_Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Commission on Cancer 7-digit codes (assigned by COC until the end of 2000)

PermissibleValues.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Commisssion on Cancer Facility Identification Number 10-digit codes (assigned 2001+)

PermissibleValues.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ReferenceDocuments.name: FIN Coding System Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: This field identifies the coding system used by facilities in the following seven fields of the NAACCR layout: Registry ID [40] (when Registry Type [30] = 3), Reporting Hospital [540], Institution Referred From [2410], Institution Referred To [2420], Last Follow-Up Hospital [2430] (this data item was retired in Version 11), Following Registry [2440], and Archive FIN [3100]. Within a single NAACCR record, all of these fields listed above must be coded using the same FIN coding system.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Version 12 Updated Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: The rationale and instructional text for NAACCR elements was significantly updated for Version 12.  Please refer to the documentation for new usage information.
